text: Héctor Cúper (born 16 November 1955) is a former Argentine football player. He has played for Argentina national team. ==International career statistics== |- !Total||5||0 |} ==Managerial statistics== Team From To Record G W D L Win % Ref Huracán 1 July 1993 30 June 1995 Lanús 1 July 1995 30 June 1997 Mallorca 10 July 1997 31 May 1999 Valencia 1 July 1999 30 June 2001 Internazionale 22 June 2001 17 October 2003 Mallorca 2 November 2004 13 February 2006 Real Betis 14 July 2007 2 December 2007 Parma 11 March 2008 12 May 2008 Georgia 8 August 2008 15 October 2009 Aris 8 November 2009 18 January 2011 Racing Santander 1 July 2011 29 November 2011 Orduspor 20 December 2011 13 April 2013 Al Wasl 12 November 2013 4 March 2014 Egypt 2 March 2015 26 June 2018 Uzbekistan 1 August 2018 23 September 2019 DR Congo 13 May 2021 9 June 2022 Syria 2 February 2023 present Total — ==Honours== ===Player=== Ferro Carril Oeste *Primera División: 1982 Nacional, 1984 Nacional Huracán *Primera B Nacional: 1989–90 ===Manager=== Huracán *Primera División runner-up: 1994 Clausura Lanús *Copa CONMEBOL: 1996 Mallorca *Supercopa de España: 1998 *Copa del Rey runner-up: 1997–98 *UEFA Cup Winners' Cup runner-up: 1998–99 Valencia *Supercopa de España: 1999 *UEFA Champions League runner-up: 1999–2000, 2000–01 Aris FC Thessaloniki * Greek Cup runner-up: 2009–10 Egypt * Africa Cup of Nations runner-up: 2017 Individual *La Liga Coach of the Year – Don Balón Award: 1999 *UEFA Club Coach of the Year: 2000 *Globe Soccer Awards best Best Arab National Team Coach: 2017 *CAF Coach of the Year: 2017 ==References== Category:Argentine footballers Category:Argentine football managers Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Valencia CF managers Category:Club Atlético Huracán managers
